qas.question: What year did the Arthur Ravenel Jr. Bridge open?

What year was the Grace Memorial Bridge built?
What year was the Silas N. Pearman Bridge built?

context: The Arthur Ravenel Jr. Bridge across the <a4_0><b9_0>Cooper River<b9_0/><a4_0/> opened on July 16, <a0_0><b5_0>2005<b5_0/><a0_0/>, and was the second-longest cable-stayed bridge in the Americas at the time of its construction.[citation needed] The bridge links <a1_0><b6_0>Mount Pleasant<b6_0/><a1_0/> with downtown Charleston, and has eight lanes plus a 12-foot lane shared by pedestrians and bicycles. It replaced the Grace Memorial Bridge (built in <a2_0><b7_0>1929<b7_0/><a2_0/>) and the Silas N. Pearman Bridge (built in <a3_0><b8_0>1966<b8_0/><a3_0/>). They were considered two of the more dangerous bridges in America and were demolished after the Ravenel Bridge opened.
